purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses from os.networkInterfaces() flow to Buffer.from().toString('base64')
Hostname from os.hostname() flows to http.request()
User info from os.userInfo() flows to http.request()
External domain names from _tmp_2 array flow to http.request()
anomalies: Use of hardcoded external domains that appear to be part of a tracking or monitoring service
Sending system identifiers (MAC addresses, hostname, user info) to external domains
Use of 'rejectUnauthorized: false' in HTTP requests which disables SSL certificate verification
Base64 encoding of system identifiers before sending
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then sends this data via HTTP GET requests to known tracking/monitoring domains. The use of 'rejectUnauthorized: false' suggests potential man-in-the-middle attack capabilities. This behavior is highly indicative of telemetry or data exfiltration functionality commonly found in malicious software.
conclusion: This code exhibits clear signs of malicious behavior with data collection and exfiltration to external servers.
